alice.goal: Help find the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 when all participants are available while respecting preferences to minimize disruption to Bob's morning.

bob.goal: Help find the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 when all participants are available while minimizing interruption to my morning schedule.

carol.goal: Help find the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 when all participants are available.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the participants' availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that finds the earliest 30-minute slot on 2025-10-21 when all three are available, breaking ties by minimizing interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

public_information: Three colleagues need to schedule a 30-minute meeting on Tuesday, Oct 21, 2025.
The goal is to find the earliest 30-minute time slot when Alice, Bob, and Carol are all available.
If multiple suitable slots exist, choose the one that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

share_availability.system_prompt: You are Alice. Provide your availability for the meeting date as a list of non overlapping time intervals in 24-hour HH:MM format with start and end times.
share_availability.prompt: State your availability for 2025-10-21 using intervals such as ["09:00-11:00", "13:00-16:00"]. Do not produce PDDL. Provide structured intervals only.

share_availability.system_prompt: You are Bob. Provide your availability for the meeting date as a list of non overlapping time intervals in 24-hour HH:MM format with start and end times.
share_availability.prompt: State your availability for 2025-10-21 using intervals such as ["10:30-12:00", "14:00-15:30"]. Do not produce PDDL. Provide structured intervals only.

share_availability.system_prompt: You are Carol. Provide your availability for the meeting date as a list of non overlapping time intervals in 24-hour HH:MM format with start and end times.
share_availability.prompt: State your availability for 2025-10-21 using intervals such as ["09:30-10:30", "11:00-12:30", "15:00-17:00"]. Do not produce PDDL. Provide structured intervals only.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi agent PDDL planning and in preparing encodings for the FastDownwards solver. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that encodes the scheduling task. Keep each participant represented as a distinct actor if actions are modeled. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Indicate in comments or metadata that the output targets FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You receive the structured availabilities from Alice, Bob, and Carol for the date 2025-10-21 and the meeting duration of 30 minutes. Find the earliest 30-minute slot when all three are available. If multiple slots are possible, prefer the slot that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule. Produce a PDDL domain and problem encoding suitable for FastDownwards that represents the scheduling constraints and yields the desired slot. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
